summary: This document is a chain of emails from December 2018, forwarding a 2016 email from attorney Peter Skinner. The 2016 email discusses a news report about Jeffrey Epstein's relationships with young women and provides legal documents related to a case. The 2018 emails show follow-up inquiries about meetings and notes related to the case.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Attorney who sent the original 2016 email, attaching legal documents for review and discussing a news report about Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Lead attorney on the case, added to the email chain by Peter Skinner, described as knowing the facts of the case very well.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded news article link discussing his continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion.

connections.description: Colleagues/attorneys working on the same case; Skinner adds McCawley to the email chain as a lead attorney.
Skinner is communicating about a case involving Epstein, attaching legal documents for review.
McCawley is described as a lead attorney on a case related to Epstein.

events.title: Page Six Report on Epstein
events.description: The New York Post's Page Six reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Attorney Meeting and Document Sharing
events.description: Peter Skinner sends a follow-up email after a meeting, attaching legal documents including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 for review.

events.title: Follow-up on Meeting Notes
events.description: An email inquiry is sent asking for any notes and/or records from a meeting with Skinner, and whether there were any further meetings relating to Epstein.

keyFacts: A 2016 Page Six news report is cited, discussing Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion.
Attorney Peter Skinner shared legal case documents including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 in February 2016.
Sigrid McCawley is identified as a lead attorney on the case who knows the facts well.
In December 2018, there were follow-up inquiries seeking notes/records from meetings with Skinner and information on any further meetings related to Epstein.
The email chain indicates ongoing legal or investigative activity concerning Jeffrey Epstein between 2016 and 2018.
